answers.answer: I'm sorry you are going through so much.  Your right, one persone should not have to endure so much.  But sometimes it seems that we are the pick of the litter.  Lucky us, we get it all.  Keep a positive attitude if you can and turn it over to God.I'll be praying,Carol

Oh my gosh - The old saying "when it rains it pours?" - I am so sorry this has hit you.  My dad lived with heart problems for 20 years and I know how scary that can be.I can identify with the overweight and smoking, me too.  Started on this new stuff Chantix to help me quit smoking, it is helping but haven't totally quit yet.You are in my prayers and I just know that things will be okay for you.  The good thing is that they caught this now and you can take care of it before anything really bad happens.Please keep in touch with us and keep us informed on your progress.  Just imagine that when you are going through all this all of us here are with you holding your hand.  You are a part of all this now and we are all here for you.God Bless and Keep YouDoni

Hi LL,  boy that is alot to deal with. Let us know what you find out with the xrays. Hopefully they wont' make you wait and wait to hear the results. That always slays me. And that diabetes puts us at higher risk for so many other things, its just not fair.Did you say you are in N. OH? (its my neck of the woods)Jazzy

Nope, I'm in Oregon, a looonnnng ways away LOL Thanks for the kind words. Should be able to get report on x-rays either tomorrow or Friday. Receptionist wasn't too receptive to my having a copy, but my dr had written right on the order that I could have a copy. Will let you all know how it goes. Haven't heard back from Cardiologist yet to schedule an appt. I suppose that will take a couple of weeks, then more to work into their schedule. We could all pass on before doctors get around to seeing us!  Have a good evening.

question: Update on doctors appointment....Saw my PCP today, and told him about my rapid heart rate episode on Sunday night. Heat issues, etc. After examining me, he found that my heart murmur is back. 3 1/2 yrs ago an EKG done in ER due to rapid heart rate episode found that I have an enlarged right ventricle. The upshot is that he is referring me to a Cardiologist for a workup. Mr dcotor said my sx of leg pain, feet & ankle swelling, and intolerance for climbing stairs could be heart related. My Dad passed away 3 years ago with a massive heart attack. I'm overweight, smoke (yeah, I know) and other health issues, but this one slapped me along side the head. I am scheduled for lung & heart X-rays tomorrow. PCP is putting off referral to rheumatologist until after Cardiac consult, as he feels this is a more important issue, since my last bloodwork came back with very high reticulocyte count, and high ferritin. Also have highC-Peptide and CRP highly sensitive was 4.8.Extremely high, which is Cornary Heart Disease risk. How much more can go wrong in one person! I'm on ToprolXL for the rapid heart rate, so shouldn't have had 2 episodes in 6 weeks.  Yikes! The only good thing is my blood pressure.LOL Any words of encouragment greatly appreciated!  Hope you are feeling well today Doni.......Maggie
